results.summary: How children traumatised by the murder of a 16-year-old stabbed on a bus were helped by channelling their memories into producing a magazine.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/6a659253-9cf6-e048-a44f-841194a7e39e"><image id="66556969"/><paragraph role="introduction">The murder of 16-year-old Christina Edkins, stabbed while on her way to school in the West Midlands, shocked her friends and acquaintances.</paragraph><paragraph>Christina was attacked on a bus on Birmingham's Hagley Road as she travelled to Leasowes High School in Halesowen in March.</paragraph><paragraph>Pupils at the schools she had attended found different ways of dealing with their grief, including fundraising and tributes on social media.</paragraph><paragraph>Pupils at two Catholic primary schools, one of which Christina attended, were encouraged to produce a magazine celebrating "youth and children's young experiences".</paragraph><paragraph>Lorraine Sergeant, the mentor at St Patrick's Catholic Primary School in Ladywood, said this helped the children "channel their memories [of Christina] in a positive way".</paragraph><paragraph>"Even though this was a very sad event, this was a way to show the children that it was not wrong to talk about someone who's gone," she added.</paragraph><crosshead>Memorial trophy</crosshead><paragraph>St Edmund's Catholic Primary School, which Christina attended, is a sister school to St Patrick's, with shared staff and activities.</paragraph><paragraph>Ms Sergeant said as there were so many children who had been upset by Christina's murder, producing the magazine was the best way to deal with the children's feelings.</paragraph><image id="68879182"/><paragraph>"It has helped them come to terms with it - during any counselling with any children who have suffered a bereavement we encourage them to think about the cycle of life."</paragraph><paragraph>She said that parents were still able to refer their child for extra sessions of counselling if they felt it would help.</paragraph><paragraph>The magazine the pupils produced was sold, raising £95. </paragraph><paragraph>At the request of Christina's family the money will be used for a trophy to be given each year to a child who has made an outstanding achievement in sport.</paragraph><paragraph>A trophy will be presented each July for 16 years - the number of years that Christina lived.</paragraph></body>
